content: I found that horizontal_sum internally uses simd_reduce_add_ordered, but I also found another intrinsic simd_reduce_add_unordered, and it seems that they are similar except a base value, and I can't find any comments about the difference. Why horizontal_sum uses the former?
The difference is wether the compiler is allowed to reorder the addition operations I believe. This can change rounding and is thus observable, so _ordered doesn't allow it.
